title: Formal Launch of Skardu International Airport Upgradation Project — A Vision for Regional Development
content:
ISLAMABAD, Jun 20 (APP):In a significant stride toward enhancing aviation infrastructure and fostering regional connectivity, the upgradation of Skardu International Airport has been formally launched on Friday.
The landmark initiative is set to play a pivotal role in unlocking the economic and tourism potential of Gilgit-Baltistan.
The official project launch ceremony took place at a local resort in Skardu, where the joint venture consultancy — comprising renowned Swiss aviation firm Intairplan and its Pakistani partners — presented their comprehensive strategic blueprint for the airport’s development.
The high-level event was attended by senior officials from the Pakistan Airports Authority, including the Director Planning & Development, Additional Director Project Monitoring, Project Director Skardu International Airport, and the Airport Manager Skardu. Also present were senior representatives from the local administration, armed forces, law enforcement agencies, and various stakeholder institutions.
The consultancy cost for the upgradation design has been fixed at Rs. 180 million. Construction work is expected to begin within a year, following the completion of the detailed design and PC-1 documentation.
Reaffirming their commitment to the project, all stakeholders pledged full cooperation to ensure its timely execution. They lauded the Pakistan Airports Authority for its proactive role in transforming Skardu into a key hub for international tourism and trade, and for driving the broader economic uplift of the region through enhanced air connectivity.
The Skardu International Airport Upgradation Project stands as a beacon of progress for Gilgit-Baltistan, promising new avenues for development, global integration, and long-term prosperity.
